ygData.subject: Early bard grouping (was RE: Twinking)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Well, luckily I have a rl level 35 bard friend who I talk all the tima and ask him for advice.  In groups though, I still wonder about my song selections
ygData.messageBody:
On Tue, 5 Oct 1999 kim@... wrote:

> From: <kim@...>
> experience loss hurts. For the folks grouped with him though,
> this can be another matter, as they end up grouped with a
> player who either does not know how to play the class to best
> advantage (e.g. bards doing nothing but bellowing during a
> fight, then healing after), or gets them into situations
> likely to get them killed because hey if one of them is a
> close match for me, three of them should be no problem for my
> group of six.

Well, luckily I have a rl level 35 bard friend who I talk all the tima and
ask him for advice. In groups though, I still wonder about my song
selections some time. Soloing I use warsong, bellow, bellow, because I'm
fighting white or yellow con'sing monsters and I need the extra damage
from bellow to win the damage race. In a group of two, I actually sing
anthem, warsong, bellow, since I am probably better equipped then my
groupmate and it would be better for me to tank, so I try and pull it on
myself. In larger groups I sing anthem, healing, bellow, and I think
that's pretty much the standard right? Obviously I drop the last song if
the lag gets too high, which is almost always bellow.

Miriana Winderyder
Lvl 50 Cleric
Lvl 15 Bard
